entry.title: Sleep, My Love
entry.content: ğŸ¥ Sleep, My Love, 1948 â­ï¸ â˜…â˜…â˜…Â½ A solid variation on the gaslight thriller with a few twists along the way. Claudette Colbert is, as expected, excellent, graceful, expressive, and totally believable as a woman being driven to the brink. The film leans more into melodrama than menace, but it works, thanks to its noirish atmosphere and a plot that keeps things moving. Not quite Gaslight, but an entertaining ride nonetheless. ğŸ”— https://letterboxd.com/julienpierre/film/sleep-my-love/ #FilmReview

entry.title: Bluebeard's Eighth Wife
entry.content: ğŸ¥ Bluebeard's Eighth Wife, 1938 â­ï¸ â˜…â˜…â˜…â˜… Gary Cooper feels a bit miscast at first, but somehow, it works, especially when playing off the magnifique and always impeccable Claudette Colbert.
